lines.text: My friend was killed here last night.
No one asked him to break in here.
And who asked you to play God with these animals?
Dean, you can't ignore this.
This is, uh, just a car accident.
Since when do cars eat your liver?

[looking at burnt rodent]
This isn't the rat!
Of course it is.
There is no yellow spot! The rat I injected had a yellow spot on it!
Hey, You're looking at a barbecue buddy. This rat could have been a goddamn dalmatian for all we know.
What? Uh, you're gonna take a flamethrower for a rat?
No, obesity-breath. This is no ordinary flamethrower. See, I modified this baby myself. I just find the rat, aim, and... kazoom.
[first lines]

[chanting and wearing a cow mask]
Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights! Animals have rights!
[sees Delhurst approaching]
Professor Delhurst! Professor Delhurst, I wanna talk to you.
Would you get out of my way, please? I'm late.
For what? Another execution?
Somebody call security.
The animals keep checkin' in, but they don't check out, do they? You're not a scientist, you're an undertaker!
[Delhurst shoves past him]
We are not through, Professor Delhurst!

[stops, turning]
Within the next decade, two of you will die of cancer. I'm doing my best to reduce those figures.
What an asshole.

[introducing Neil to the giant child]
Bobby, I want you to meet my colleague, Dr. Hamilton.
I'd like you to get the fuck outta here!
It's all right.
Get outta here! Are you deaf? Get outta my room! Get outta here, you bitch, get outta here! Get outta my room!
How did you come up with this?
It's an accidental hormone concoction. It's like tryin' to make a martini and endin' up with LSD.
[finding Delhurst, who was turned into dog cancer]
Edmund? God, you look awful.

[after almost being killed by Jacques' flamethrower]
Ya got a light?

[mopping up blood]
This blood's dried up crustier than old Delhurst.

[looks at cancer cells under a microscope]
Amazing. The cells are multiplying at an incredible rate! Mitosis at the speed of light!
A sequence analyzer. Where did this come from?
It's for a private project.
Moonlighting, Neil?
Well, judging from this morning's paper, you don't exactly restrict your research to cancer, do you?
Neil, I'm a colleague in need.
I'm under a deadline, Edmund. I'm sorry.

[becoming angry]
Deadline? You've been working for years to produce... produce that only Lilliputians would appreciate!
[he calms down]
I'm sorry, I didn't mean that. The flowers are lovely.
Lemme tell ya, I've seen an awful lot of rats in my time. Some big, some very, very small. But that was the Loch Ness Monster of rats.

[answers the telephone]
Hello?... Yeah he's here, sort of
[laughs, then whispers to Neil]
It's Dr. Travis!
Hello, Kate? Look, if it's about the job, I'm still not interested, I...?
[hesitates and listens, looking concerned]
... I'll be on the next flight.
[hangs up the phone]
Joshua...

[annoyed but jokingly]
Yes Neil, I will find someone to cover your lecture. I'll feed your little girlfriend...
[holds up Neil's beloved pet white rat with a smile]
... and I won't ask any questions.
[Joshua strokes the rat while Neil leaves the lab]

[foreboding tone]
I won't forget this, Hamilton...

[holds up a Kodak Instamatic]
I thought you said we were just gonna take pictures, Mark!
...I LIED.
[starts smashing the flasks and test tubes, making a mess of the whole room]

[Neil's pet rat accidentally knocks over and shatters a flask, then runs away. Neil plays "Three Blind Mice" on a wooden flute, and the rat faithfully returns to him, climbing onto his arm and resting on his shoulder]
... Well ol' girl... I'd better put you to bed before you bankrupt the department.

[Joshua has just found a disemboweled corpse, and he is leaning over the railing in shock. Neil rushes over to him and notices the sewer with running water]
It's a sewer system... could be where the nest is.
You're going to need more than just tracking dogs...

[confused]
Why?
Water...
[coughs violently]
dogs that can follow a scent in water...
[continues coughing]

[worried]
... You alright?
[Joshua nods his head, on the verge of crying. The scene changes and Zeke is heard screaming in terror]

[Neil and Alex rush through the tunnels to find Joshua bleeding to death on the ground. Neil kneels down beside him in concern]
Josh!
[Joshua moans in pain]
Oh, don't worry... listen up buddy, we're gonna get you to a med center, don't worry about it.
[Neil puts his hand over the rat bite to stop the bleeding]

[softly]
You son of a bitch... I see you're smoking again... I smell it on your breath...
[both of them laugh sadly]
... give me one.
Hang on, bud.
[with tears running down his face, Neil takes a cigarette from his pocket, lights it and gives it to Joshua]
It works...
[Joshua weakly holds up the radio-transmitter device but then bleeds to death. Neil starts crying, in grief over the loss of his best friend]

[livid and in tears herself, Alex walks up to the police]
NOW will you admit that there's a problem?

[nonchalant]
She's right, we gotta do somethin'...
Of course we've got to do something... I'll, uh, call some exterminators and Lieutenant, you get together your best men and... find them and kill them, kill them all.
We have got a plan! And we can...
I think that the exterminators can take care of this! I want extra security around the sports complex, the official opening is in two hours, and I see no reason to do anything but. Get on it!
[the Dean walks off, leaving Alex looking disgusted]
This is the food of the gods! You realize how valuable this is? Big cows. Big fish. Big pigs. Food for everyone and anyone! We're talkin' the end of world hunger, here.

Finding rats is not a police matter. I've already got the exterminators on that. Lieutenant, as I'm sure you're aware, the grand opening of the pool takes place in three days. Now, uh, I don't think we need to have any publicity on this unfortunate incident, do you?
All I see is a dead kid without a face.
[the two exterminators arrive]
I can't believe they called us in to find one stupid rat. How the hell are we supposed to find one rat?
[turns on TV]
What are you doing?
I'm watchin' the game. Hey, I mean, we already caught the rat anyway. Huh? Huh?
You see that's exactly what's wrong with this country. Nobody takes pride in their work anymore.
[holds up flamethrower]
I do. I'm a professional.

[not paying attention]
What'd you say?
Nothin', nevermind.
A lot more people are gonna get hurt while you guys are sittin' around waitin' for autopsies to tell you somethin' that's starin' you right in the face!
What does it cost to pay for your lab, Hamilton? To pay for your salaries, research, the roof over your head?
Come on, Dean, we don't have time...

[interrupting him]
Any idea what it costs to run an entire university? I know. And I know how to keep it running 'cause that's my job. I also know that if this university is shut down because of giant rats, no one is gonna send their kids here and no one is gonna donate one red cent. Tonight is the grand opening of that building. There are going to be a lot of wealthy alumni with checkbooks in hand. You understand me?
[after Brett has been killed]
I came as fast as I could! This is incredible! How did you do this? Do you realize the possibilities?
Your assistant is lying here dead, and all you can think of are the scientific possibilities?
How is the poor boy?
[Neil is running after Alex]
Alex, wait a minute, will ya? Hey! Will you slow down a second?
Why should I?
Because I can't explain a thing to you if you're runnin' away.
It's not working. Months of experiments, eleven different formulas, now a scalp transplant and it's still not working.

We're wasting our time with animals, Professor Delhurst. We give them massive doses of radiation so they'll lose their hair, then we try to make it grow back again, but it won't. Just end up dying from cancer.

Don't be an idiot all your life, Brett. They pay me to study cancer. The Institute expects animal research. They expect radiation treatments. If it happens that I stumble on a cure for baldness, lucky me. And lucky you, too, baldy.
Rats like this kind of shit!
A little early for huntin' season, ain't it, Doc?
...Zeke, you know you can't be down here? It's not safe!
Tell that to the kids freezing their asses off. Heat's off. Besides, I been comin' down here for twenty years. Ain't nothin' gonna sneak up on me.
You just keep your eyes open! Holler if you see anything!
Like giant rats, Doc?
[breaks into a wide smile and laughs, shaking his head before riding away on his floor polisher]
You're wrong about this, Neil! You can't possibly believe that I, a fellow scientist, would actually stoop to...!
[Neil slams the lab door in his face, looking dismayed]

]
Sometimes I think he loves you more than he loves me...

[glances up from the telephone]
I wouldn't say that!
She's never liked me.
Well, she's jealous!
[both of them laugh]
